definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
erhua variant of 橡子麵|橡子面[xiang4 zi5 mian4]

sentences.english: Perhaps only tenth of them will grow.
sentences.chinese: 大概只有十分之一的橡子能够成长。

sentences.english: THIS little chipmunk is hungry. Can you help him get to his acorns?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮这只花栗鼠找到橡子吗？

sentences.english: In this paper, the technological conditions of acorn bean jelly are mainly discussed.
sentences.chinese: 主要探讨了橡子凉粉的生产工艺参数和配方。

sentences.english: Some birds collect nuts and acorns to store.
sentences.chinese: 一些鸟儿收集坚果和橡子去储存。

sentences.english: The action ripens and the hickory nut matures. The plant commits its future to the seed and the root.
sentences.chinese: 橡子熟了，山桃黄了，植物把未来寄托给种子和根须。

sentences.english: Relax, and give your life a lift with an Acorn Stairlift.
sentences.chinese: 放松，给你的生活与一个橡子座椅电梯升降机。

sentences.english: Every oak must be an acorn.
sentences.chinese: 每棵橡树都曾湜壹粒橡子。

sentences.english: On his back was a sack of acorn. In his hand was a four-foot length of iron pipe.
sentences.chinese: 他背着一大袋橡子，手里拿着一根4英尺长的铁管。

sentences.english: The tree grew from a small acorn.
sentences.chinese: 橡树从一粒小橡子生长而来。

sentences.english: ' First thing you know, we'd all be eating stewed chickweed and acorns.
sentences.chinese: 首先你知道，我们都得吃炖繁缕和橡子。

sentences.english: The oaks also suffer from deer eating their sprouts and acorns.
sentences.chinese: 鹿在不断地吃掉橡树幼芽和橡子，橡树也深受其害。

sentences.english: The acorn ripens and the hickory nut matures.
The ground under towing oaks is often littered with thousands of half-eaten acorns.
sentences.chinese: 高达的橡树下经常有成千上万啃了一半的橡子。

definition: variant of 包穀|包谷[bao1 gu3]
(dialect) maize/corn/also written 苞穀|苞谷[bao1 gu3]
mulberry tree, with leaves used to feed silkworms
